title: Daily added sugar intake in England in 2008 - 2012 , by age group
summary: This bar chart has 5 columns on the x axis representing Age Group, and Sugar intake in grams in each Age Group on the y axis.
The Sugar intake in grams is appeared to be the highest at Age Group Teenagers 11-18 years and lowest at Age Group Children 1.5-3 years.
The maximum Age Group Teenagers 11-18 years has got 2.06 times higher Sugar intake in grams than the minimum Age Group Children 1.5-3 years.
min_summary: This bar chart has 5 columns on the x axis representing Age Group, and Sugar intake in grams in each Age Group on the y axis.
The Sugar intake in grams is appeared to be the highest at Age Group Teenagers 11-18 years and lowest at Age Group Children 1.5-3 years.
mid_summary: This bar chart has 5 columns on the x axis representing Age Group, and Sugar intake in grams in each Age Group on the y axis.
The Sugar intake in grams is appeared to be the highest at Age Group Teenagers 11-18 years and lowest at Age Group Children 1.5-3 years.
The maximum Age Group Teenagers 11-18 years has got 2.06 times higher Sugar intake in grams than the minimum Age Group Children 1.5-3 years.
max_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Sugar intake in grams for 5 number of Age Groups.
The Sugar intake in grams is highest at Age Group Teenagers 11-18 years and lowest at Age Group Children 1.5-3 years.
The minimum Age Group Children 1.5-3 years has got 2.06 times less Sugar intake in grams than the maximum Age Group Teenagers 11-18 years.
Sugar intake in grams at Age Group Teenagers 11-18 years is 74.2 , second place is Children 4-10 years at 60.8, and thirdly is Adults 19-64 years at 58.8.
The Age Group Teenagers 11-18 years tends to be 1.32 percent higher than average.
Summing up the values of all Age Groups, we get total 281.5.
